meanings.definition: Not able to be reduced or simplified.
meanings.sent1: The complexity of the problem was irreducible to a simpler form.
meanings.sent2: The concept of love is irreducible to mere words.
meanings.sent3: Trying to explain the magic trick to a child was irreducible to their understanding.
meanings.sent4: Her infectious laughter was irreducible, spreading joy to all around her.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of the sunset was irreducible, leaving everyone in awe.

meanings.definition: Incapable of being made smaller or simpler.
meanings.sent1: The irreducible size of the box made it impossible to fit through the door.
meanings.sent2: The irreducible truth of the matter could not be ignored.
meanings.sent3: His stubbornness was irreducible, even in the face of overwhelming evidence.
meanings.sent4: The bond between the two friends was irreducible, standing strong through all trials.
meanings.sent5: The impact of her words was irreducible, leaving a lasting impression on all who heard.

meanings.definition: Unable to be broken down into smaller parts.
meanings.sent1: The irreducible complexity of the cell structure baffled scientists.
meanings.sent2: The irreducible unity of the team led to their success.
meanings.sent3: The mystery of the ancient artifact was irreducible, puzzling archaeologists.
meanings.sent4: The irreducible bond between mother and child is unbreakable.
meanings.sent5: The irreducible essence of the story captured the hearts of readers.
